fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An agency report about Antonio Reyes-Minana said that he had been jailed for “deliberately infecting” two former lovers with HIV. He was convicted by a jury of two counts of grievous bodily harm relating to the reckless transmission of HIV, not the deliberate transmission of the virus (Man jailed for infecting former lovers with HIV, 16 August, page 12). • The government has not cancelled all contracts with the adult training provider Learndirect, as we said in an article. On Tuesday, the Department for Education announced that it will withdraw all of its funding from the organisation. Learndirect has contracts with other government departments that have not been cancelled (Learndirect hit by DfE funding cut after report by watchdog slams company, 16 August, page 4). • Other recently corrected articles include: How a 1947 US government anti-Nazi film went viral after Charlottesville The Death of Louis XIV review – a quietly amazing portrait of the end of life Monday’s best TV: Cheap Cheap Cheap; Scotland’s Model Teenager; EasyJet: Inside the Cockpit Frances Colquhoun obituary
